A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
I fell asleep. During a *Star Wars* movie *I* fell asleep.
That's a big statement.

Here's what went wrong (I was awake enough to catch the gist)

Poor writing ....just awful....I mean where was Rey's training? Why was Luke such a lame duck? Why wouldn't the captain tell Poe what was going on? What was the reason for building up Snoke only to kill him off so non- chalantly? Why did the imperial guards' fight scene seem like it was ripped out of a bad kung fu movie? What the *heck* was up with the casino cutaway? 

The galaxy and the world needs heroes. Star Wars isn't meant to be simply entertaining - it's meant to be atmospheric\, powerful. Disney obviously doesn't grasp that concept or respect the groundwork laid by Abrams in episode VII. Overall\, I find their lack of vision and my subsequent lack of faith in the franchise disturbing. 

In short\, the only scene I found any comfort in was watching Luke dissipate into the force if only to be saved from the cruel pens that inked this storyline.
